title: New Mexico High School Football Week 9 Preview
text:
New Mexico High School Football Week 9 Preview Kyle Henderson NMPreps.com Publisher 
It's finally Friday on NMPreps.com and today we preview the entire state of New Mexico like no one else. Here is a look at our week 9 high school football preview. Head back to NMPreps.com starting at 4:00PM MST for Live Coverage. 
Week 9 Schedule The New Mexico High School Football Season enters week 9 and there is no better place to catch all the live coverage than at NMPreps.com each Friday Night. Live scores tonight at 4:00PM MST New Mexico High School Football Schedule 
Thursday, October 22nd Rio Rancho 36, Cibola 17 Final Atrisco Heritage 44, Rio Grande 7 Final Eldorado 71, Highland 16 Final 
Friday, October 23rd 
No. 1 Cleveland @ No. 8 Volcano Vista Cleveland 7-0, 1-0 
No. 3 Las Cruces - Open Las Cruces 6-2, 2-0 
No. 4 Artesia @ No. 20 Roswell Artesia 6-1, 0-0 
No. 6 Rio Rancho defeated Cibola 36-17 Rio Rancho 7-2, 3-0 
No. 7 Eldorado defeated Highland 71-16 Eldorado 7-2, 2-1 
No. 8 Volcano Vista vs. No. 1 Cleveland Cleveland 7-0, 1-0 
No. 9 Clovis @ No. 14 Hobbs Clovis 4-3, 0-0 
No. 10 Cibola lost to Rio Rancho Rio Rancho 7-2, 3-0 
No. 12 Sandia vs. La Cueva Sandia 5-3, 1-1 
No. 13 Mayfield vs. Deming Mayfield 4-3, 1-0 
No. 14 Hobbs vs. Clovis Clovis 4-3, 0-0 
No. 15 St. Pius X @ Moriarty St. Pius X 8-0, 0-0 Moriarty 6-2, 0-0 
No. 16 Piedra Vista @ Aztec Piedra Vista 6-2, 2-0 
No. 18 Moriarty vs. No. 15 St. Pius X St. Pius X 8-0, 0-0 Moriarty 6-2, 0-0 
No. 20 Roswell vs. No. 4 Artesia Artesia 6-1, 0-0 
No. 22 Espanola @ Los Alamos Espanola 7-0, 1-0 
No. 23 Portales vs. Ruidoso Portales 7-0, 1-0 
No. 24 West Mesa - Open West Mesa 3-5, 2-0 
No. 25 Atrisco Heritage - Defeated Rio Grande 44-7 Atrisco Heritage 3-5, 3-0 Full Recap Here Top 25 Sophomores 
Today on NMPreps.com we highlight the top Class of 2018 prospects (current) sophomores in the State of New Mexico. We have a very special group of high caliber athletes coming up. Scroll down to read the complete feature. 
Pictured: Manzano's Jordan Byrd catches a pass during the NMPreps.com 2015 Elite Combine. He holds an offer from the University of New Mexico. Top Class of 2018 Prospects Jordan Byrd - Manzano - Receiver/Quarterback/Athlete - The fastest man in New Mexico (4.3 40-time/10.7 100M Dash) and already holds offer from New Mexico. New Subscriber? Click Here | Returning Subscriber Click Here To Continue Reading Payton Ball - Las Cruces - Running Back - In his first year as a starter, Ball has been a great addition to the Bulldawgs line up. He ran for 100-yards and 3 touchdowns recently against Gadsden. On the season he has rushed for 266-yards and 11-touchdowns. | Returning Subscriber Click Here To Continue Reading | New Subscriber? Click Here 
Complete Breakdown On The Top 25 Class of 2018 Prospects Here Week 9 Picks 
Each Thursday of the New Mexico High School Football Season, Kyle Henderson of NMPreps.com makes his weekly prep football picks. The Match Up Hendo's Pick Del Norte @ Capital Taking the upset pick here. Think the Knights keep their playoff hopes alive in a thriller. Clovis @ Hobbs The Eagles win back the Little Rebel - Expecting a ton of points and a ton of fans Friday at Watson St. Pius X @ Moriarty Thought about taking the upset here, but St. Pius X is better than people are given them credit for. La Cueva vs. Sandia Taking Big Red to move to 2-1 in district St. Mike's @ Hope Christian Horsemen are able to out-run Huskies in a 4 hour type game Belen @ Los Lunas Flipped a coin here and it landed on it's side... Rio Rancho @ Cibola The red hot Rams keep rollin, pick up a 2 touchdown win over the Coogs tonight Alamogordo @ Carlsbad Carlsbad keeps it close for a while, Tigers able to muscle two touchdown victory Hatch Valley @ Cobre Bears take down Indians in key district game, move to 9-0 Cleveland @ Volcano Vista I think this game is going to be close, Hawks are no joke. No. 1 stays No. 1 though... Gallup vs. Miyamura Could be closer than expected, still rollin with the Patriots Albuquerque @ Valley Vikings win a late season district game, last second touchdown needed Artesia @ Roswell
